keyMoments.title: Public Coup Announcement
keyMoments.description: The New Fish-Man Pirates execute their coup d'état by broadcasting Hody Jones's takeover announcement across all of Fish-Man Island, declaring Neptune's execution and Hody's rule.
keyMoments.significance: This marks the full-scale takeover attempt by the New Fish-Man Pirates and sets the stage for the climactic battle.

keyMoments.title: Forcing Citizens to Renounce Otohime
keyMoments.description: The New Fish-Man Pirates force citizens across the island to step on portraits of Queen Otohime, threatening death to those who refuse.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the crew's tyrannical methods and complete rejection of human-fishman peace.

keyMoments.title: Threatening the Straw Hat Pirates
keyMoments.description: The New Fish-Man Pirates hold Zoro, Usopp, and Brook captive and threaten to execute them as examples to surface humans.
keyMoments.significance: Directly challenges the Straw Hat Pirates and escalates the conflict to a personal level.

jollyRoger.description: A skull with sharp teeth and a crown, representing their ideology of fish-man supremacy

keyMoments.title: Crew Members Held Captive
keyMoments.description: Zoro, Usopp, and Brook are held captive by the New Fish-Man Pirates and threatened with execution, forcing Luffy to take action.
keyMoments.significance: The threat to crew members drives Luffy's determination to fight despite the political complications.

keyMoments.title: Robin Discovers Joy Boy's Apology
keyMoments.description: Nico Robin, the crew's archaeologist, deciphers the Poneglyph in the Sea Forest and discovers crucial information about Joy Boy and ancient promises.
keyMoments.significance: The Straw Hats continue to uncover world-changing historical information through Robin's unique abilities.

ships.description: The Straw Hat Pirates' second ship, currently docked at Fish-Man Island

jollyRoger.description: A skull wearing a straw hat with crossed bones behind it
